clinical_study.brief_title: Enhanced Recovery Program After Laparoscopic Colon Cancer Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Implementation of an Enhanced Recovery Program After Laparoscopic Colon Cancer Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: An enhanced recovery program has been developed to provide for colon cancer patients faster and more personalized postoperative treatment. Most of the previous studies have showed that the efficacy of the enhanced recovery program on both subjective and objective physical recovery of patients. However, such studies are rarely conducted in South Korea. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the feasibility and efficacy of a postoperative enhanced recovery program in patients who underwent laparoscopic colon cancer surgery at a tertiary hospital in Korea.

primary_outcome.description: Duration of hospital stay from the date of operation to the date when a patient meets the following "discharge criteria". Discharge criteria: Tolerance of consecutive 3 soft diet Recovery of bowel function (without PONV) No necessity of intravenous analgesics Stable vital sign (afebrile)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 30days from time of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: EORTC QLQ-C30, before and after surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 30days from time of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Body weight, body mass index, body composition, before and after surgery

arm_group.description: early recovery program with no preoperative mechanical bowel preparation, early diet initiation, and prevention of postoperative ileus after elective laparoscopic colon cancer surgery

intervention.description: Enhanced recovery program day-1: no mechanical bowel preparation, intake permit until 6 hrs before operation day0: operation, postoperative fluid therapy, antibiotics day1: liquid diet, early ambulation, removal of foley catheterization day2-3: soft diet day 4-5: discharge

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Eligibility rule of enrollment
- ECOG 0-2
- Pathologically diagnosed colon cancer
- Stage I-III
- No functional disturbance in liver, kidney, bone marrow
- Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Emergent operation
- Obstructive or perforated cancer
- Rectosigmoid or rectal cancer
- Synchronous tumor
- Uncontrolled psychiatric or neurologic problems
- Severe hepatic dysfunction (GOT, GPT ≥100IU/L)
- Renal dysfunction (Cr ≥2mg/dl)
- Recent MI, CVA, nitrate medication
